page.title: 01Footpaths in Ampleforth.
page.content: There are several very enjoyable footpaths in the village, some carrying on for many miles. One leads down by a river past a mill, another branching off this leads down the valley on a walk of about 1.5 miles to Old{Pilfit farm.}A number leave the main road and run by it for a few miles. One of these leads up through a private garden along the side of a small valley and to the right of {Studford}or{Studfold Ring,}a rectilinear embanked enclosure with an internal ditch, probably of Iron Age origin. The moors either side of the valley reach heights of about 750 feet and the valley sides gently slope down to about 230 feet. Two streams flow down to the valley to{Shallow dale}and to Smith Hill. There are pleasant walks beside each of these.
